page.title: 17PELLS SWEET FACTORY
page.content: {Pells}was established in 1870. It was a family business until 1983. There are 21 people employed there most of whom are women. The factory has 24 machines which produce 1.5 tons of sweets every week - a large output for a small enterprise. The sweets produced from a sugar-glucose base, are exported to the{Bahamas and other {countries}but most are sent to the {North of England.}They produce{22 {varieties,}the most popular of which is one called{"Old English Mints".}The stripes are put into the mints by laying strips of white mixture on the brown coloured base. The whole mixture is then rolled together, stretched and fed into the machine. Accidents are quite frequent, the common being burns from the hot sweet mixture.
